prim_db: # Detailed descriptions of columns in this file:

prim_id: The name of the database (file name) that contains the primary motif.
A name for the primary motif that is unique in the motif database file.
An alternate name of the primary motif that may be provided
A consensus sequence computed from the primary motif (see doc/motif-consensus.html).
The name of the database (file name) that contains the secondary motif.
A name for the motif that is unique in the motif database file.
An alternate name of the secondary motif that may be provided
A consensus sequence computed from the secondary motif (see doc/motif-consensus.html).
Number of positions trimmed from left of secondary motif
Number of positions trimmed from right of secondary motif

prim_db: # If the next three fields are not blank, the motif is redundant with a more significant ('parent') motif.

prim_id: The database (file name) that contains the parent motif.
A name for the parent motif that is unique in the motif database file.
An alternate name of the parent motif that may be provided
The expected number motifs that would have least one

prim_alt: spacing as enriched as the best spacing for this secondary.
The E-value is the best spacing p-value multiplied by the number of motifs in the
The distance between the edge of the primary and the (trimmed) secondary motif.

prim_id: The (combination) of quadrants for which occurrences
The number of occurrences of the secondary motif with the

prim_alt: given spacing and orientation to the primary motif.

prim_id: The total number of occurrences of the secondary motif within the

prim_alt: margins around the best primary motif occurrence.

prim_id: The p-value of the gap and orientation, adjusted for

prim_alt: nine combinations of quadrants times the number of gaps tested

prim_id: The p-value of the gap and orientation adjusted only for the number of gaps tested.
